page.title: 11BRIERLEY HILL HIGH STREET
page.content: {Brierley Hill High Street}is situated on a section of the main {Dudley}to{Stourbridge}road and is virtually equidistant to both these towns. In recent years the High Street has undergone (and is stll undergoing) considerable change. Like many High Streets up and down the country, the traditional family shops have all but disappeared. The one exception to this is the busy{Brierley Hill Market}and in here it is still possible to talk to stall holders whose families have occupied a particular stall for many generations. A few years ago a new super store,{Asda,}was opened in the town and this led to a decline in trade in the smaller High Street shops.Consequently,some of these shops ceased trading and were either left empty or taken over by banks, building societies or estate agents.
